title: Delhi car blast: 'Madam Surgeon' emerges as key player; diaries hint at 'D-6 Mission'
content: Investigators are unraveling a sophisticated Jaish-e-Mohammed plot, allegedly masterminded by Dr. Shaheen Shahid, dubbed "Madam Surgeon." The module, involving Kashmiri doctors, planned coordinated strikes and a December 6th attack to "avenge" the Babri Masjid demolition. Financial trails and overseas meetings with ISI handlers are under scrutiny.

title: EC orders 'Special Revision' of Assam voter list, final roll in Feb; how it differs from SIR
content: The Election Commission has ordered a Special Revision of Assam's electoral rolls, with January 1, 2026, as the qualifying date and the final list due February 10, 2026. This focused update aims for accuracy, falling between routine and intensive revisions. The process involves door-to-door verification by BLOs using pre-filled registers.

title: 'Precautionary decision': Two SL cricketers return from Pak before tri-series
content: Sri Lanka's T20 tri-series campaign faces a setback as captain Charith Asalanka and fast bowler Asitha Fernando are returning home due to illness. The board termed the move precautionary, ensuring their recovery. Dasun Shanaka will lead the team in Asalanka's absence. Pavan Rathnayake has been added to the T20I squad as a replacement.

title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death: Can she challenge the verdict? A look at possible scenarios
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has sentenced ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to death for crimes against humanity. Found guilty of ordering killings and inciting violence during a student uprising, Hasina can appeal the verdict within sixty days. India may refuse extradition if the charges are deemed political, adding to Bangladesh's political uncertainty.

title: Jeff Bezos is taking up a new 'CEO job' and it's not with Amazon
content: Jeff Bezos is back in a formal leadership role. He is co-chief executive of a new AI startup called Project Prometheus. The company has secured a massive $6.2 billion in funding. Project Prometheus aims to revolutionize manufacturing and engineering. It will focus on AI for sectors like aerospace and automotive. Top talent from OpenAI, DeepMind, and Meta have joined the startup. This venture marks Bezos's first operational role since leaving Amazon.

title: Sai Sudarshan or Devdutt Padikkal - Who should replace Shubman Gill in Guwahati Test?
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill's neck spasm casts doubt on his participation in the second Test against South Africa. Former spinner Anil Kumble suggests Sai Sudharsan as a potential replacement if Gill is unfit, while also noting Devdutt Padikkal as another batting option. India aims to avoid a series defeat after their Kolkata loss.

title: Lost Rs 32cr in 6 months: Bengaluru techie fell for ‘digital arrest’ scam
content: A Bengaluru woman lost nearly Rs 32 crore in a sophisticated "digital arrest" scam. Posing as CBI officers, fraudsters subjected her to constant Skype surveillance, threatening immediate arrest. Over six months, she made 187 bank transfers, believing she was proving her innocence, before receiving a fake clearance letter.

title: Narayana Murthy points to China’s 9-9-6 rule to justify 72-hour work weeks
content: A debate on work-life balance is reignited in India. Infosys founder N. R. Narayana Murthy suggested young Indians adopt a 72-hour work week. This sparked immediate backlash from workers citing long commutes, rising expenses, and constant after-hours communication. Employees emphasize that current long hours do not yield better results. They seek fair pay, predictable hours, and time for rest.

title: Ford CEO Jim Farely sounds alarm over US's position on AI, Anand Mahindra backs claim
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley and billionaire Anand Mahindra highlight a critical US shortage of skilled tradespeople.  Thousands of well-paying mechanic jobs remain unfilled, signaling a potential 'dream career' reset.  Mahindra suggests those who build and fix things will be AI era's biggest winners, urging a societal re-evaluation of vocational value.

title: Watch: Protesters storm Mujibur Rahman’s house after Hasina verdict; clash with cops
content: Protests erupted in Bangladesh following ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's death sentence for 'crimes against humanity.' Demonstrators attempted to dismantle Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman’s house, clashing with security forces who used batons, sound grenades, and tear gas to disperse the crowds. The interim government called the verdict 'historic' while Hasina denounced it as 'biased and politically motivated.'

title: Delhi blast: NIA nabs ‘active co-conspirator’; accused provided tech support, tried to make rockets
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested Jasir Bilal Wani, a key associate of the terrorist involved in the Red Fort car blast. Wani allegedly provided technical support by modifying drones and attempting to make rockets. This arrest follows the apprehension of another aide who facilitated the car's purchase, bringing the NIA closer to uncovering the conspiracy.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
content: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.

title: Who Is Marco Acortes? Mystery Man Behind Viral 2013 Coronavirus Tweet
content: An obscure tweet from 2013 by online creator Marco Acortes, stating "Corona virus….its coming," gained widespread attention in 2020 when COVID-19 emerged. The post, which has not been edited, resurfaced again in 2025, sparking speculation about Acortes's prescience. He has since ceased all social media activity, leaving his current whereabouts and the inspiration behind the tweet a mystery.

title: ‘Prioritise passion over perfection,’ says AI godmother Fei-Fei Li: What professionals need to know
content: Fei-Fei Li, Stanford professor and CEO of World Labs, urged young AI professionals to focus on passion, mission, and meaningful impact rather than overanalyzing technical details or credentials. Emphasizing creativity, adaptability, and alignment with teams, Li’s guidance highlights the importance of soft skills and long-term vision in building a successful AI career, echoing global industry perspectives.

title: Pakistan camp goes berserk after beating India A; clip goes viral – Watch
content: Mohammad Faiq and Maaz Sadaqat — who finished unbeaten and carried Pakistan home — were visibly fired up as they headed back to the dugout. High-fives, roars and bear hugs followed as the players celebrated the emphatic result.

title: 'Sab darr ke khel rahe hain': Mohammad Kaif hits out after 93 all out
content: Mohammed Kaif believes selection uncertainty under Gautam Gambhir is hindering India's Test batters at home. He cited the exclusion of Sai Sudharsan and Sarfaraz Khan's inconsistent selection despite good performances, suggesting players are fearful and lack backing. This instability was highlighted after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test.

title: Saudi bus crash: Death toll rises to 45; CM announces ex-gratia of Rs 5L - top developments
content: A devastating bus fire near Medina in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of 45 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana, with only one survivor. The blaze spread rapidly, preventing most passengers from escaping the tragedy. This incident marks one of the most severe overseas accidents involving pilgrims from the state in recent years.

title: Hailee Steinfeld Says Last Thanksgiving Was a ‘Disaster’ as She Reveals New Plan
content: Hailee Steinfeld is gearing up for Thanksgiving with Josh Allen, recalling a disastrous baked brie attempt last year. This time, she plans a simpler charcuterie board. The actress also reflected on her relationship with Allen, appreciating the NFL schedule's impact on their life together, and shared a new annual family ritual.

title: IPL captaincy: 'Giving reviews to owners' - KL Rahul reveals toughest part
content: Indian cricketer KL Rahul finds IPL captaincy more taxing than international duty, citing extensive meetings and ownership reviews. The Indian batter revealed that the constant questioning from owners, often lacking cricket insight, leaves him mentally and physically drained post-tournament. Rahul, now a player for Delhi Capitals, has stepped down from captaincy.

title: Rohini Acharya row: Lalu Yadav’s sprawling family tree — 7 daughters, 2 sons and political fault lines
content: The Yadav family, long a dominant force in Bihar politics, faced internal fractures after the RJD's significant defeat in the 2025 assembly elections. Long-simmering resentments over perceived overshadowing and the influence of Tejashwi Yadav's advisors erupted into open conflict, shattering the family's public image of unity.

title: 'Lost control but ... ': Hasina's first reaction after Bangladesh court sentences her to death
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina has defied a death sentence for "crimes against humanity," calling the International Crimes Tribunal's ruling politically motivated. She claims the August 2024 student protests, which led to her government's fall, were not a premeditated assault. Hasina insists on facing charges in a legitimate court, highlighting her government's human rights achievements and economic growth.

title: India-US trade deal soon? First tranche near closure! Would be 'highly detailed'
content: India and the US are nearing a trade deal, addressing reciprocal and oil tariffs. Discussions are underway to finalize a package including US market access and tariff adjustments. Officials indicate negotiations are largely complete, with a resolution expected soon.

title: IPL 2026: Kumar Sangakkara to Ricky Ponting - Full list of coaches for all 10 teams
content: Kumar Sangakkara has been reappointed as head coach for Rajasthan Royals for the 2026 IPL season, replacing Rahul Dravid. This comes after a disappointing performance by the Royals. Meanwhile, Abhishek Nayar has been named the new head coach for Kolkata Knight Riders, succeeding Chandrakant Pandit.

title: Zaccharie Risacher Exit Throws Hawks Into Chaos as Atlanta Faces Turmoil
content: Atlanta Hawks' Zaccharie Risacher suffered a hip injury during a game against the Phoenix Suns. The young star fell after a slam dunk and was unable to continue. This exit has caused concern for the franchise. Risacher had scored 15 points before the incident. His availability for upcoming games remains uncertain as the team awaits updates on his condition.

title: 'Shoe bomber' in Delhi? NIA probes terrifying new angle in Red Fort blast
content: Investigators are exploring a chilling possibility in the recent Red Fort suicide bombing: the attacker may have used a shoe bomb. A recovered shoe with a metallic component, potentially a trigger, and the suspected use of TATP explosive, echo the infamous 2001 shoe bomb attempt. This sophisticated attack, linked to a module of radicalised doctors, has left agencies stunned.

title: 'Crimes against humanity': Bangladesh's ousted PM Hasina sentenced to death; key takeaways
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been convicted of crimes against humanity by the International Crimes Tribunal for her role in the violent crackdown on student protests. The unrest led to the collapse of her government, with Hasina now living in exile in India. The verdict follows months of hearings, with prosecutors labeling her the "mastermind" behind the attacks.

title: First win in 15yrs! Bavuma's 'jump and punch' celebration against India goes viral - Watch
content: After the victory, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma’s wild celebrations were captured in a video circulating on social media. He leapt in the air, punched his fists with delight, and embraced head coach Shukri Conrad.

title: Al-Falah University and the cracks in India’s accreditation system
content: A terror investigation into the 10 November Red Fort blast has unexpectedly exposed major flaws in India’s accreditation system. As Al-Falah University came under scrutiny, NAAC, AIU and Delhi Police simultaneously flagged alleged fake accreditation claims, triggering notices, suspensions and FIRs. The episode reveals how easily institutions can project legitimacy—and how slowly regulators act until a crisis forces intervention.

title: 'Adolescence' to 'The Death of Bunny Monroe': Child-centric adult dramas topping global charts
content: Global dramas like 'Adolescence' and 'The Death of Bunny Monroe' are centering child actors in complex adult narratives, a trend starkly absent in India. This contrasts with the Kerala State Film Awards' decision to not honour child actors, sparking debate about their role in Indian cinema.

title: Furious Dana White bans Dillon Danis for life after UFC 322 chaos
content: Following a chaotic crowd brawl at UFC 322, Dana White has banned Dillon Danis from all future UFC events. The incident, involving Danis and members of Islam Makhachev's team, overshadowed the main card. White acknowledged his miscalculation in allowing Danis near Makhachev's entourage, citing Danis' long-standing feud with Khabib Nurmagomedov's associates.

title: Shatrughan Sinha and wife Poonam visit to check on Dharmendra's health
content: Shatrughan Sinha and wife Poonam visited Hema Malini to check on Dharmendra’s health after his hospital discharge. On Monday, Shatrughan shared photos and a heartfelt message from the visit. Dharmendra recovered at home post-treatment, with family requesting privacy. He and Shatrughan have also acted together in several notable Bollywood films.

title: 'Big achievement': Afridi drags in Pak's victory over India A; remarks after SL win go viral
content: Pakistan's ODI team clinched a dominant 3-0 series win against Sri Lanka, a victory amplified by Pakistan Shaheens' triumph over India A in the Asia Cup Rising Stars. Captain Shaheen Afridi lauded both achievements, highlighting the team's confidence and the impressive comeback of Mohammad Wasim Jr. after injury. The Shaheens' chase was spearheaded by Maaz Sadaqat's explosive 79.

title: 'If Pak gives us an opportunity …': Army chief’s warning after Delhi blast; calls Op Sindoor a 'trailer'
content: Army chief has issued a stern warning to Pakistan and terror groups, stating that the recent Operation Sindoor was merely a preview of India's capabilities. He emphasized that India will retaliate against both terrorists and their state sponsors, asserting that the nation is prepared for future challenges and will not be intimidated.

title: Mecca–Medina tragedy: Govt releases list of 45 passengers; Hyderabad families await updates
content: A tragic road accident in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of over 40 Indian Umrah pilgrims, all reportedly from Hyderabad. A passenger bus carrying pilgrims from Mecca to Medina collided with a diesel tanker, with many victims believed to have been asleep at the time. Authorities are working to identify all deceased and provide assistance to affected families.

title: 'Bihar approves Gobi farming': Assam min’s post sparks row for ‘alluding to 1989 Bhagalpur riots’
content: Assam minister Ashok Singhal's post on "gobi farming" after Bihar poll results has sparked outrage from the Congress. The opposition alleges the imagery alludes to the 1989 Bhagalpur violence, where victims were reportedly hidden under cauliflower plantations. Congress leaders condemned the remark as "vulgar and shameful."

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal dips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices retreated on Monday following hawkish remarks from US Federal Reserve officials, dampening hopes of an imminent rate cut. This sentiment shift pulled bullion prices lower after a strong rally last week. Traders are now awaiting crucial US economic data, particularly the non-farm payrolls report, for further policy cues.

title: Bihar results: Almost equal vote share for Owaisi’s AIMIM and NOTA
content: In Bihar's recent assembly elections, Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM and NOTA secured nearly identical vote shares, polling 1.85% and 1.81% respectively. Experts suggest this parity reflects voter disenchantment with mainstream parties, while the decline of traditional parties like CPI also warrants closer examination.

title: NHL Injury Update: Charlie McAvoy out after slapshot in the Montreal Canadiens
content: Boston Bruins star defenseman Charlie McAvoy suffered a facial injury after a slapshot during Saturday's game. He was seen being helped off the ice and is currently undergoing tests. His return for upcoming games remains uncertain, causing concern for fans and the team. Updates on his condition are eagerly awaited.

title: India needs 86 million higher education enrolments by 2035 to meet NEP goals: Report
content: India’s higher education sector faces an unprecedented expansion push, with a new report warning that achieving the NEP 2020 goal of a 50 percent GER will require 86.11 million enrolments by 2035. As traditional campuses strain under capacity and skill demands shift rapidly, the report urges digital ecosystems, flexible learning, and quality-focused reforms to prevent India’s demographic advantage from eroding.

title: 'Have faith in Shami': Ganguly's message to Gambhir after Eden shocker
content: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sourav Ganguly reiterated his call for Mohammed Shami's Test comeback, emphasising the need to trust proven pacers like Bumrah, Siraj, and Shami. Ganguly also urged coach Gautam Gambhir to prepare better wickets, stating Team India needs solid batting foundations to win Test matches.

title: ‘Hubby’s innocent’: Blood-written message on floor was UP man’s last bluff after killing wife
content: In a shocking twist in Prayagraj, a husband attempted to mask his wife's murder as a suicide. He penned a fabricated confession using her blood, but investigators quickly spotted the red flags—there simply wasn't enough blood for the message.

title: Who is Rameez Nemat Khan? 'Outsider' behind Lalu family’s turmoil; ex-cricketer faces 12 criminal cases
content: RJD chief Lalu Prasad's daughter Rohini Acharya blamed "outsiders" for the party's electoral defeat, pointing to former cricketer Rameez Nemat Khan and RJD MP Sanjay Yadav. Khan, son-in-law of jailed politician Rizwan Zaheer, faces multiple criminal cases, including murder and Gangsters Act charges, despite being granted bail in several instances.

title: Inflation at record low! Will your loan EMIs come down further? Explained
content: Retail inflation in October has hit its lowest level since 2013 - the time that this series of CPI inflation started. At the start of 2025, the repo rate stood at 6.5% - and as the end of the year approaches, it has come down by a full 100 basis points! Where will the easing cycle stop? Will RBI wait for more clarity on the India-US trade deal, or is time ripe for another rate cut?

title: Kerala University V-C postpones Syndicate meeting, citing lack of security on campus
content: Kunnummal criticises the police for allegedly yielding to political pressure and failing to provide him adequate protection during a confrontation where his car was obstructed by protesters

title: Tickets on trains to Kerala sold out well ahead of Christmas-New Year season
content: When the booking site is opened, a ‘regret message’ pops up prompting the user to explore other means to transportation

title: Form expert committee to discuss sugarcane issue, State govt. told
content: Viresh Sobaradmath Swami has said that the State govt. should look into the issues concerning sugarcane growers, sugar mills and resolve them

title: Tamil Nadu archaeologists join excavations at Berenike in Egypt to trace ancient Mediterranean trade links
content: In 1995, archaeologists unearthed a potsherd at Berenike bearing the Tamil-Brahmi text korrapuman. The TNSDA has joined the current season of excavations at the ancient port city on the Red Sea coast to identify more evidence of ancient trade links between the Tamils and the Romans

title: India pitches digital solidarity at global telecom meet in Baku
content: Pemmasani Chandra Shekhar highlights India’s low-cost, large-scale digital model, fastest 5G rollout and robust anti-fraud systems, urging nations to build trusted and inclusive digital ecosystems

title: Sugarcane growers stage rasta roko in Kalaburagi
content: They are demanding a Fair and Remunerative Price of ₹5,500 per tonne of sugarcane based on 9.50% recovery rate and uniform price across State

title: Minister assures to resolve major issues in Nellore
content: The MA&UD Minister lays foundation stone for the construction of new road works at Sunday Market and at underbridge near Atmakur Bus Stand in the city

title: Chief Secretary slams negligence in welfare hostels
content: Vijayanand warns wardens and officials of strict action; appreciates timely completion of Data Lake project at RTGS

title: T.N. government warns its workers against taking part in strike called for Tuesday
content: Chief Secretary N.  Muruganandam has asked the authorities to instruct the employees not to violate the provisions of the Tamil Nadu Government Servants’ Conduct Rules, 1973, and warn them of disciplinary action for any violation

title: DSS to take out State-wide protest march on Nov. 25
content: It is to express solidarity with Minister Priyank Kharge who is facing online abuse after questioning RSS accountability, its functioning

title: LDF replaces candidate for Padivattom division
content: Sini George, who withdrew citing ill health, has been replaced by Shiny Anilkumar, an Area Development Society chairperson active in the division for 15 years

title: Mamata again urges Modi to withdraw order appointing interlocutor on Gorkha issues
content: The letter she had written on the same issue on October 18 was acknowledged by the Prime Minister’s Office and forwarded to the Union Home Minister, the West Bengal Chief Minister pointed out

title: 45 departments yet to submit caste data, BC Commission sets 10-day deadline
content: It warned that if the data is not submitted within 10 days, a meeting will be convened with the Secretaries of the departments concerned

title: IMD begins weather forecast for Sabarimala amid limitations
content: Special weather forecasts and nowcasts being issued for the pilgrims arriving as part of the two-month-long annual Mandalam-Makaravilakku

title: Andhra Pradesh Haj Committee Chairman leads prayers for victims of Saudi bus tragedy
content: Leaders across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana express condolences after 45 Umrah pilgrims, many from Hyderabad, lose their lives

title: Siblings nabbed in train theft case, ₹84.50 lakh cash recovered
content: Accused changed their mobile phones and SIM cards and planned to escape to Chennai, says investigation officers Fateh Ali Baig and J.V. Ramana

title: New digital schemes will ‘de-unionise’ workers, says federation
content: The CWFI cited “fundamental flaws” and “anti-worker implications” of the new measures and urged the Centre to stop the roll-out of the schemes

title: RSS worker’s death: police investigate possibility of abetment
content: In their formal statements, Anand’s relatives told the investigators that he faced no family or financial difficulties and he had been deeply distressed after being denied the seat

title: NIA arrests another key alleged conspirator in car bomb blast case
content: Jasir Bilal Wani aka Danish was a co-conspirator and had worked closely with the alleged terrorist, Umar Un Nabi, to plan the car bomb attack, said the agency

title: LDF finalises seat-sharing talks in Kottayam district panchayat, announces candidates
content: Discussions completed in municipalities and block panchayats and candidates to be announced soon, says district convener

title: Sixteenth Finance Commission submits its report for 2026-31 to President Murmu
content: The Union Cabinet had on November 29, 2024, approved the terms of reference for the 16th FC. At the time, it had also said that the Commission was to submit its report by October 31, 2025

title: U.S. trade deal: First tranche dealing with reciprocal tariffs to be closed soon, says govt official
content: Commerce Secretary and chief negotiator for India on the Bilateral Trade Agreement Rajesh Agrawal travelled to Washington with his team for the sixth round of negotiations on October 15-17, indicating that tensions were easing.

title: CM Revanth has deep regard for artistes and Dalits: SC Welfare Minister
content: The Minister said the Chief Minister has consistently stood by Dalits, recalling the historic decision on SC categorisation and the recognition extended to artistes

title: Government urged to safeguard nearly 1,200 acres of farmland submerged in Kadapa district
content: According to Andhra Pradesh Rythu Sangham State Committee, farmland belonging to 10 villages inundated after water from Brahma Sagar Reservoir entered Porumamilla tank

title: 18th Russian Language and Literature Festival begins in Thiruvananthapuram
content: 18th Yesenin Award was presented to C.S. Suresh for his contribution to promoting Russian literature through translation

title: A.P. govt. ratifies land requisition for 580-acre Global Toy Park in Anakapalli
content: The global toy sector is valued at $120 billion, but India currently accounts for less than 0.5% of global exports

title: Telangana government asks CCI authorities to resolve issues of ginning mills
content: Agriculture Minister says CCI’s decision to cap per-acre cotton procurement at just seven quintals, far below the State’s average yield of 11.74 quintals, has deeply affected farmers

title: Annadata Sukhibhava - PM Kisan payout to begin from November 19, farmers assured ₹7,000 each
content: The Centre will release ₹2,000 and the State government to add ₹5,000 of its share depositing  ₹3,077.77 crore into the accounts of 46.6 lakh farmers in the State

title: Kerala HC asks SEC to decide on Wednesday plaint against ‘deletion’ of candidate’s name from voters’ list
content: Congress candidate in Muttada ward in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation says her and her parents’ names were deleted from the voters’ list of the ward after her candidature was announced. HC says since she has produced documents as address proof, the SEC must consider her plea and pass appropriate orders. The last date to file nomination is November 21

title: ICAR Deputy Director General stresses need to promote diversified food systems
content: 20th International Symposium of the International Society for Tropical Root Crops gets under way in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Mastermind behind iBomma and Bappam film piracy racket nabbed by Hyderabad Cyber Crime police
content: Police seized hard drives containing nearly 21,000 films across multiple languages from mastermind Emandi Ravi. He earned an estimated ₹20 crore, which he used to purchase flats and plots, said an officer, adding that about ₹3.5 crore in his bank accounts has been frozen

title: Maha padayatra from Khammam to Hyderabad for RTF dues
content: All India OBC Students Association (AIOBCSA) says the march has a single demand: the immediate release of dues for SC, ST, BC, Minority and EBC students

title: Centre urges speedy rollout of pumped storage projects to tap surplus green power
content: Union Power Minister Manohar Lal urges States to remove levies and speed up clearances; proposes floating solar units to curb reservoir evaporation losses

title: BJP warns Congress govt. against diluting 42% BC quota in local body polls
content: Former MP and BJP vice-president B.Narsaiah Goud alleges that efforts are under way to “cheat” the BC community again under the pretext of legal hurdles

title: Madanapalle kidney racket: police intensify search to track down nine more accused
content: Police have so far arrested six people, including a senior government doctor and two technicians of government dialysis units and middlemen

title: KSCA elections postponed to December 30
content: A notice issued by the KSCA office of the Electoral Officer stated that “elections cannot be conducted at this stage without removing the doubts among members”, and thus the election process must be deferred to December 30

title: Scrapping of Senior Professor posts sparks outcry in Kerala’s universities
content: Govt. cites financial constraints for not including the post in its pay revision schemes. Academics say move could destabilise the State’s higher education ecosystem and undermine long-term academic leadership

title: Brother of Al-Falah University head arrested for fraud in Madhya Pradesh
content: The accused was arrested from Hyderabad in connection with three cases of fraud registered 25 years ago at Mhow police station in Indore district

title: I&PR Minister alleges cover-up in ₹100-crore TTD Parakamani theft case
content: Kolusu says the 2023 theft was diluted through a compromise memo and raises doubts over the vigilance officer’s ‘suspicious’ death

title: ‘Karthika Brahmotsavams’ off to a colourful start at Tiruchanur
content: ‘Tiruchi Utsavam’ performed after the early morning rituals when the idol of Goddess Padmavati was taken out in a procession around the temple

title: Don't cross 50% reservation limit in local body elections: Supreme Court to Maharashtra government
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi said the local body elections in the state can only be held as per the situation prevailing prior to the 2022 J.K. Banthia Commission report

title: Pharmacy students urged to build industry-ready skills
content: India’s pharmaceutical sector is poised to become a USD 100-billion industry, driving the need for well-trained professionals, says Central Bureau of Communication Assistant Director

title: ‘Perennial’ GRAP is not the solution for Delhi’s air pollution: Supreme Court
content: The toxicity had to be dealt with gradually, through a long-term policy, which did not impact the livelihoods of migrant labourers and daily wagers, the apex court said

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 11: MVP for Josh Allen? Sack record for Myles Garrett?
content: Is Allen a prime MVP candidate again? Has the AFC West torch been passed? We overreact to Week 11, plus fantasy football takes.

title: Sanders rues 'rough' debut after Gabriel concussed
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders made his NFL debut Sunday against the Ravens, coming on after fellow rookie Dillon Gabriel was concussed.

title: NYPD seeking suspect in shooting of Jets' Boyd
content: New York police have released surveillance images of a man sought in the shooting of Jets player Kris Boyd.

title: Seattle LB backs Darnold: If you rip QB, 'f--- you'
content: Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, coming off his worst performance of the season, received the full backing of his team and coach following Sunday's loss to the Rams.

title: Source: Concern Rodgers has break in left wrist
content: The initial concern is that Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has "a slight break" in his left wrist, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Jake Paul to fight ex-heavyweight champ Joshua
content: YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul will face former two-time unified heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua in a professional heavyweight boxing match on Dec. 19 at Kaseya Center in Miami, Most Valuable Promotions told ESPN on Monday.

title: Pistons' Cunningham, Nike reach new 6-year deal
content: Pistons star Cade Cunningham has reached a new six-year endorsement agreement to re-sign with Nike and will receive his own signature shoe, his agents told ESPN.

title: Mahomes takes blame as division title hopes fade
content: Patrick Mahomes took much of the blame for the Chiefs' 22-19 loss to the Broncos, an outcome that leveled the team's record at 5-5 and put their hopes at winning another AFC West title in doubt.

title: Draymond confronts fan over 'Angel Reese' chant
content: Draymond Green went nearly chest-to-chest with a fan during the Warriors' road game against the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night.

title: The Chiefs aren't broken -- but they could miss the playoffs: Barnwell on what has gone wrong
content: The Chiefs are 5-5 after losing to the Broncos. They're third in the AFC West, and ESPN's FPI has them at 55.4% to make the playoffs. Is it time to worry?

title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: A weekend with the banana suits and shirtless fans surviving Oklahoma State
content: It has been a bad year for the Pokes. It hasn't stopped their fans from making their own bright spots.

title: Trade AD? Wait for free agency? Tank? Every option in Dallas
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: From Josh McDaniels to Dan Campbell: What has gone right, wrong for every NFL OC, playcaller this season
content: NFL Nation reporters break down the good and bad for each OC/playcaller and peg the key to success the rest of the season.

title: Players react to efforts to halt team report cards: 'Pushback shows it's working'
content: NFL players who spoke to ESPN say the report cards are making a tangible impact on workplace conditions.

title: 'I'm probably going to cry': Inside DeMarvion Overshown's long journey back from knee surgery
content: Overshown's breakout 2024 season for Dallas was cut short by a horrendous knee injury. Here's how he fought his way back.

title: Raiders offense was meant to make strides under Kelly, but the opposite has occurred
content: From national champion and Pro Bowler to ... league-worst offense? What's next for Chip Kelly and Geno Smith.

title: The NHL's best this week: How the Devils move forward minus Jack Hughes
content: One of the game's elite players will be out eight weeks for a division leader. Plus, a look at the week's key games.

title: From multiple A-pluses to ... a whole lot of F's: Grading bold season predictions for all 30 MLB teams
content: It's time to see if what we said about each club going into the season was accurate or not -- and what it means for 2026.

title: Week 11 winners and losers: Allen, McCaffrey dominate; Chase, Jefferson go quiet
content: Josh Allen, Christian McCaffrey and Sean Tucker led the way with big Week 11 performances, while Ja'Marr Chase, Justin Jefferson and Lamar Jackson were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Tucker goes off for Buccaneers; Packers lose Jacobs, Ridley's season over
content: Sean Tucker had 140 yards and three TDs in early Sunday action, but injuries abounded again in Week 11.

title: Orlando's NWSL title defense is over, so what's next for Marta?
content: Marta was the best player on the field Sunday, but it wasn't enough to inspire Orlando past Gotham FC.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot in 27 years and became one of Europe's best
content: Norway have players like Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard but haven't made a World Cup since 1998. Now they have, and it's taken some change.

title: Ukraine keep World Cup hopes alive with clinched playoff spot
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it looks around the globe.

title: Draft risers, questions and notes: How does this WR class stack up?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 12, including why Zachariah Branch and Makai Lemon are intriguing prospects.

title: Man United's plan: Save millions in wages, rebuild midfield
content: Next summer looms as a busy transfer period for Manchester United: More than £1 million in wages will be offloaded, which will in turn free up space for some major midfield upgrades.

title: Emirates' $38 Billion Shopping List In Dubai Comprises 65 Boeing 777-9s
content: The biennial Dubai Air Show opened Monday with hometown airline Emirates ordering 65 of Boeing's upcoming 777-9 aircraft.

title: Sri Lankan Man Asks For Sex, Masturbates In Front Of Solo Traveller From New Zealand
content: A solo woman traveller from New Zealand, who has been on a road trip across Sri Lanka on a tuk tuk, was subjected to harassment and indecent exposure by a local man, an incident she detailed in a video that has since gone viral.

title: Before Delhi Blast, Terrorists Planned Hamas-Like Attack Using Drones
content: The white collar terror module involved in the Delhi suicide car bomb attack planned to modify drones to weaponise them, and make rockets for use before the November 10 terror strike near the Red Fort, investigators have said.

title: Why A Grieving Serbian Mother Is On Hunger Strike Since 16 Days
content: A grieving Serbian mother reached her 16th day of a hunger strike, becoming a new focal point of the country's rumbling protest movement even as fears grow for her health.

title: Bacterial Infection Kills 31 Blackbucks At Karnataka Zoo, Probe Ordered
content: Thirty-one blackbucks have died at a zoo in just four days due to a bacterial infection, Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre said.

title: Top Court Slams Rajasthan For Failing To Control Jojari River's Pollution
content: The Supreme Court slammed the Rajasthan authorities for their failure to control pollution in the Jojari River, saying the suffering that has been caused to two million people was "unbelievable".

title: What's Fuelling Anti-Graft Protests In The Philippines
content: More than 200,000 protesters turned out for the second day of an anti-graft rally in the Philippines, part of a wave of demonstrations since August.

title: From Student Uprising To Death Verdict: A Timeline Of Sheikh Hasina's Fall
content: The fall of Bangladesh's former prime minister Sheikh Hasina began with a student-led uprising on August 5 last year, triggering a chain of events that would ultimately lead to her conviction and death sentence in absentia on Monday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What Went Wrong For Prashant Kishor? 'Arrogance', Among Other Things
content: The 2024 Bihar polls may have been a false start for the Jan Suraaj, but whether it becomes a footnote in Bihar's political history or the foundation for a future force will depend entirely on how its leadership responds to this poll result.

title: Most Of Gaza's Schools Destroyed, Lakhs Of Children Cannot Go Back To Class
content: More than 600,000 Palestinian children in Gaza have missed the past two years of school because of the war between Israel and Hamas.

title: 'Chandrababu Naidu An Institution, A Visionary': Karan Adani At CII Summit
content: Adani Ports and SEZ Ltd Managing Director Karan Adani called Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu "an institution" and "a visionary" who "rewrote the playbook of modern industrial India."

title: Sri Lanka Probes Claims Of Cruelty To Elephants Gifted By Thailand
content: Sri Lanka is investigating allegations that two elephants gifted by Thailand have been subjected to cruel treatment at their homes in Buddhist temples.

title: Electric Vehicle Sales Are Booming In South America  Without Tesla
content: Chinese car makers are widening their footprint across South America with both traditional vehicles and EVs.

title: Russian Strikes Kill Five In Ukraine, Destroy Kindergarten
content: Russian aerial strikes on Monday killed five people and destroyed a kindergarten in eastern Ukraine, authorities said.

title: All About The Rise, Reign And Ruin Of Bangladesh's 'Iron Lady' Sheikh Hasina
content: For nearly two decades, Sheikh Hasina's name moved with the pulse of Bangladesh, sometimes steady, sometimes storm-tossed.

title: 'Committed To Best Interest Of Bangladesh': India On Sheikh Hasina Verdict
content: Hours after a special tribunal in Bangladesh sentenced ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina to death, India on Monday said it noted the verdict and that it will engage constructively with all stakeholders.

title: Air India To Resume Non-Stop Flights Between Delhi, Shanghai From Feb 2026
content: Air India on Monday announced the resumption of non-stop flights between Delhi and China's Shanghai, starting February 1 next year.

title: No Ban On Construction In Delhi, Supreme Court Says "No Temporary Solutions"
content: The Supreme Court refused a blanket ban on construction in Delhi and the National Capital Region amid 'very poor' AQI.

title: Gujarat Forest Officer Murders Wife And 2 Children, Dumps Bodies In Pit
content: The mysterious disappearance of a forest officer's wife and two children in Gujarat has turned out to be a cold-blooded murder, leading to the arrest of her husband, who allegedly dumped the bodies in a pit near his residence in Bhavnagar.

title: Madhya Pradesh Minister's 'Abusive' Call Sparks Row, She Says 'Out Of Context'
content: A Madhya Pradesh minister found herself at the centre of controversy when a videoallegedly showed her using abusive language during a phone conversation.
